description: This Kotlin source file defines the DietaryPreferencesFragment class, which is an Android Fragment responsible for displaying dietary preference and restriction options as focusable chips with custom focus behavior and styling. The fragment also includes functionality to open a modal dialog for a map interaction.

classes.name: DietaryPreferencesFragment
classes.description: An Android Fragment that displays dietary preference and restriction chips with custom focus and click behavior, and an option to open a map modal dialog.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the layout and initializes UI components, populates preference and restriction chips, and sets up focus and click handlers.

methods.name: applyChipFocusBehavior
methods.description: Configures the onClick listener for a chip to toggle its selection and applies focus ring styling.

methods.name: applyFocusRing
methods.description: Sets up custom focus change behavior on a View, including scaling and foreground drawable for focus indication.

methods.name: showMapModal
methods.description: Creates and shows a modal dialog for the map interaction.
